title: Hill-side and border sketches:
author: Maxwell, W. H.
snippet: Now and then, some priest of the Tuck standard, or him of Shoreswood, whom Scott describes as ready "to swear, and stab, and brawl," might visit the dwellings of the Borderers  ; and by the pernicious influence of their bad example, establish a thorough contempt for every thing religious in men who seemed not to comprehend that any distinction existed between right and wrong.
